data.title: [WIP] Input replay
data.body:
There is no established world-history protocol, so it's too early for the game replays.

The goal is to be able to replay the player's perspective by replaying the input. It's supposed to be a part of the real replay functionality.

Will do:
- [x] replay of actions
- [x] mouse movements
- [x] camera movements
- [ ] camera movements with keys
- [ ] testing GUI for starting/restarting the replay
- [ ] testing GUI for specifying I/O files
- [ ] doc overview (copy-paste several sentences from this PR description)

Related to the #277

Dumps ActionMode events to out.txt while playing from in.txt.

Problems: ~~held buttons~~, constness of the events, SDL_SetRelativeMouseMode.

Future work that needs real replays to be done first:
- GUI to switch between players
- handling switches between different players and the 'free mode' during the replays

data.title: Touch events
data.body:
Qt5 supports touch screens, but our input relay does not forward them yet.
Flicking the object lists by touch events would be a really nice feature.

implemented in:
`libopenage/gui/guisys/private/gui_input_impl.cpp`

used by: https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qml-qtquick-flickable.html in `libopenage/gui/qml/TypePicker.qml`

data.title: Add an option to activate the glDebugMessageCallback​
data.body:
The `glGetError` calls that are in the render loop don't indicate which GL function has caused the error. So maybe we should add an option to activate the `glDebugMessageCallback​` that will be showing that function in the stacktrace?

data.title: Project: Clean includes
data.body:
Remove some unnecessary includes.
Replace includes with forward declaration when possible.
#548

data.title: buildsystem: fixed pxdgen output regeneration
data.body:
previously, a single pxdgen input header change triggered
the retouch of every possible generated pxd output file.

this triggered the recompile of every pyx file,
so the python .so files were compiled every time.
hnng buh-buuh.

data.title: Keep unit selections when switching game mode or menu
data.body:
Don't loose unit selections when the game mode is switched. Later, e.g. when opening a chat window or pressing escape, this will become important.

Currently, the selection is lost when switching game mode.

This is a follow up for #572.

data.title: Clear the selection after exiting the ActionMode instead of after entering it
data.body:
Fixes #531.
When ending the game the selection doesn't get cleared, so changing to Action Mode after starting a new game will call `selection.clear()` which tries to access selected units from previous game.
My fix is to call `selection.clear()` when leaving the Action Mode so that the current selection will be cleared before ending the game.

data.title: Show the color of the active player in buildings preview
data.body:
Fixed the issue #554 .
This issue applies only to (Mill, Mining camp and Lumber camp), other buildings preview color is determined by [this line](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/blob/cb0afc9a29451ccb3efdd14e5103038a5c726276/libopenage/unit/unit_texture.cpp#L54).

data.title: Create option to crash the program on fatal exception
data.body:
Currently, all exceptions are caught. This is good, as one gets a shiny backtrace then.

When running in gdb, the program should terminate because of the exception, so one can directly debug from there.

This is rather easy: just rethrow the exception in the main catch clause. That way, the exception is thrown out of `main()` and the program (python.) gets `SIGABRT`ed, which is caught by gdb then.

tl;dr: add an option to rethrow an exception caught in the main function.

struct_description = "løl TODO"

data.title: convert: fix check for empty WINEPREFIX input, fixes #558
data.body: When an empty string is entered, `expand_relative_path` returns the current directory, so the `not new_wineprefix` check would always fail. This checks the input first before passing it to `expand_relative_path`.

data.title: Master server integration for lobbies
data.body:
After multiplayer games are working, we want to mediate players between lobbies.
- Anybody can host a game
- The game can be chosen to be registered at the master server
- Others can join the game either directly or via master server
- Games can be password or token protected

The masterserver is [already implemented](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage-masterserver) but needs to be further polished.

Mainly, openage now needs to implement the counterpart for the lobby stuff.

data.title: Add QML files to sanity check
data.body:
Currently, no sanity check is performed for our qml files.
Please add them so the copyright header is validated and whitespace crimes are found.

Go to `buildsystem/codecompliance/`and add it there.

data.title: [WIP] Another bold attempt at out of source builds
data.body:
- Moves python build process from cmake to setuptools
- Removes the clutter of cmake files from python packages
- Moves generation of pxd files, cython c++ files, python extension from source dir to binary dir
- Removes various buildsystem routines like pxdgen, check_py_file_list, compilepy, cythonize, inplacemodules
- Now, no configuration dependent files (config.h, config.cpp) are generated inside the libopenage directory
- Single point of version specification. Now, there is no need to invent a way to re-configure the project when the git HEAD changes
- Introduced a central source for storing and retrieving build metadata
- Removes the awkward cmake configuration for config.py.in
- Simpler approach to DEVMODE

Addresses #398 #381

data.title: Minimap
data.body:
Made some action buttons (hooked up 'kill' and 'garrison', haven't found the game logic for other ones).

Borrowed https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/pull/344 for the minimap. But can't understand why the player colours aren't bright. The player palette has only dark shades...

**update:** dissociated action buttons from this PR.
